questions.question_text: Which command is used to upload data files from a local directory or folder on a client machine to an internal stage, for a specified table?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
B is correct
https://docs.snowflake.com/en/sql-reference/sql/put
Uploads data files from a local file system to one of the following Snowflake stages:

A named internal stage.

A specified table’s internal stage.

The current user’s internal stage.

PUT does not support uploading files to external stages. To upload files to external stages, use the utilities provided by the cloud service.

questions.question_text: Which governance feature is supported by all Snowflake editions?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
D. OBJECT_DEPENDENCIES view

D is correct
D. OBJECT_DEPENDENCIES view: This view is used to show dependencies between database objects and is available in all Snowflake editions. It provides insight into how objects such as tables, views, and functions are interrelated, which is crucial for impact analysis and governance.

D is correct answer
Object tags, Masking Policies and Row Access Policies are for Enterprise and above editions. The only option remaining is Object Dependency
Source: https://docs.snowflake.com/en/user-guide/intro-editions

Selected Answer: D
Same applies to B & C. 
A, B & C all starts from Enterprise. So D is correct answer

A is not correct. 
Object tagging is available only from Enterprise Edition. 
https://docs.snowflake.com/en/user-guide/object-tagging

questions.question_text: Which chart type is supported in Snowsight for Snowflake users to visualize data with dashboards?

discussion.content:
Bar charts

Line charts

Scatterplots

Heat grids

Scorecards

Selected Answer: C
Bar charts
Line charts
Scatterplots
Heat grids
Scorecards

Selected Answer: A
A warehouse can be resized up or down at any time, including while it is running and processing statements.

Selected Answer: A
A is correct

comments.content: no you can resize it but it won't affect the current query. so changes apply for next ones
Not correct, you can resize Warehouse anytime, it just won't use new resources for the already running queries.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
False. You cannot resize a Virtual Warehouse in Snowflake while queries are running. You must first pause or terminate any running queries before resizing the Virtual Warehouse.

questions.question_text: True or False: You can resize a Virtual Warehouse while queries are running.
At what level is the MIN_DATA_RETENTION_TIME_IN_DAYS parameter set?

discussion.content:
MIN_DATA_RETENTION_TIME_IN_DAYS - Account level
DATA_RETENTION_TIME_IN_DAYS - Object / Account level

Max of these values apply.
